title: mHealth Microlearning Program for Prenatal Health Promotion

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smartphone usage skills and general understanding of prenatal health
context.additional_context: Mobile-based microlearning program for women professionals in their 30s to enhance prenatal health management competencies, applying user-friendly design based on the UTAUT model and operating with a formative assessment focus

learning_goals: Learners can explain prenatal essential nutrient intake methods with 90% accuracy via a mobile application within one week.
Learners can specify at least three recommended exercise methods for each trimester of pregnancy upon program completion.
Learners can consistently record and monitor personalized health data using an mHealth platform with over 80% adherence.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
